Description: Fragment of pottery mortarium with low broad ring foot, mended from two fragments. Inside of bowl worn, foot slightly worn. Clay light orange, relatively dense and fine, outside surface beige. Graffito underneath base: ]ναι Κρ̣̣̣̣[.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 400)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55, Table 1, Nauk 55)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p.32 fig.8, p.42 no.19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HA.18)
